This song is really calm and relaxing though.

author: Dan Hess

text: Man your music is awesome! the gyrocopter theme is my favorite! Thanks for make it!
author: Samuel

text: If there is inspiration from Steve Winwood it is indirect.  He is a great artist and I have grown up listening to his music.  When you write, it is a blend of all your influences molded by your own direction.
author: Dan Hess

text: Thanks for saying that.  I think the 40 year old reviewers just didn't get it at the time and I am glad you did!
author: Dan Hess

text: Thank you, for everything!
author: flyingfoxxx1984

text: This track used to make me sweat bullets lol
author: Michael P.

text: Hey Dan, since I see you still seem to be checking comments on this, maybe you can answer my question if you can recall your thoughts back in the 90s when making this track. Was there any inspiration from the song "Back in the High Life Again" by Steve Winwood for this track? I have to say that there are parts of the music in it that totally remind me of the Winwood song. Thanks!
author: aryzner

text:
Dude your creation flooded me with sweet nostalgia, Best piece of music on the N64 period! 

Your like famous lol!

text: Thanks, Sephicito.  Same to you.

text: Thanks, Max.

text: Pilotwings 64 is just delicious!!! I cant even tell how great I feel while flying in this game, such peaceful soundtrack!!! Only few games made me feel this way, another being Wave Race 64!!
author: chinesinha

text: I can't tell you how cool it is to find these posts and read these comments.  I'm Dan Hess, the composer for Pilotwings 64, and it's good to find out that the target audience got it, because most 40 year old reviewers at the time didn't.  Thanks for posting this!
author: Dan Hess

text: Thank you for giving me one of my fondest childhood memories!
author: n0ls

text: @n0ls You are welcome!  Thank you for the compliment!  I created a remake of Birdman on my YouTube channel if you are interested.  Also, created a Patreon page to create more!
